pages.title: Eastern Newt
pages.text: The eastern newt ($(o)Notophthalmus viridescens$()) is a common newt of eastern North America.$(br2)It frequents small lakes, ponds, and streams or nearby wet forests.$(br2)The eastern newt produces tetrodotoxin, which makes the species unpalatable to predatory fish and crayfish.

pages.title: Eastern Newt
pages.text: Relative Size: ★★★☆☆$(br2)Always active$(br2)2 Colors$(br2)Favourite Food: None$(br2)Number of Offspring: 5$(br2)Growth time: 3 Days
